tn.ref: All the people gathered as one man
tn.text: This is a generalization that indicates the people as a whole came together. AT: "The people gathered all together" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
This was the name of a large opening or doorway in the wall.

tn.ref: The Book of the Law of Moses
tn.text: This would have been all or part of the first five books of the Old Testament.

tn.ref: On the first day of the seventh month
tn.text: This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. The first day of the seventh month is near the middle of September on Western calendars. AT: "On day 1 of month 7" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"brought The Book of the Law"

tn.ref: all who could hear and understand
tn.text: This would include children who were old enough to understand what was being read.
Here "it" refers to The Book of the Law of Moses.

tn.ref: Mattithiah, Shema, Anaiah, Uriah, Hilkiah, and Maaseiah ... Pedaiah, Mishael, Malchijah, Hashum, Hashbaddanah, Zechariah, and Meshullam
tn.text: These are all names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Ezra opened the book in the sight of all the people
tn.text: The abstract noun "sight" can be expressed with the verb "see." AT: "Everyone saw Ezra open the book" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"The Book of the Law"

tn.ref: he was standing above the people
tn.text: "he was standing higher than the people"

tn.ref: when he opened it all the people stood up
tn.text: The people stood up out of respect for God's word. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The abstract noun "thanks" can be translated as a verb. AT: "Ezra thanked Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: Jeshua, Bani, Sherebiah, Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodiah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, Jozabad, Hanan, Pelaiah
tn.text: These are all names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The word "They" here refers to the Levites.

tn.ref: making it clear with interpretation and giving the meaning
tn.text: The abstract nouns "interpretation" and "meaning" can be translated as verbs. AT: "clearly interpreting and explaining it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"what was read"
This is a generalization that indicates there was great weeping among the people. AT: "For the people wept greatly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: eat the fat and have something sweet to drink
tn.text: The implied information is that the people were told to feast on rich food and sweet drinks. AT: "eat rich food and drink something sweet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Do not grieve" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: for the joy of Yahweh is your strength
tn.text: The abstract nouns "joy" and "strength" can be expressed as verbs or adjectives. AT: "rejoicing in Yahweh will protect you" or "being joyful in Yahweh will be your strong refuge" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"Be quiet!" or "Be silent!"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Do not grieve" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The abstract noun "joy" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "rejoice greatly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: the words that were made known to them
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the words that he declared to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"On day 2" or "On the next day" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
The abstract noun "insight" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "to understand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

"month 7." This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of September and the first part of October on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]])
"They should announce"
a kind of small tree with colorful flowers (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
"leafy trees"
"to make tents"
This can be translated in active form. AT: "as Moses wrote about it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"built their own tents" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
These are names of large openings or doorways in the wall.

tn.ref: in the square at the Gate of Ephraim
tn.text: "in the open place by the Gate of Ephraim"

tn.ref: For since the days of Joshua
tn.text: "From the days of Joshua"
"Nun" is a man's name. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The abstract noun "joy" can be expressed as an adjective. AT: "the people were very joyful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"each day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: from the first day to the last
tn.text: The implied information is that it was during the entire week of the festival. AT: "from the first day to the last day of the week" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"They made a feast" or "They celebrated the festival" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"on day 8" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This was a special religious gathering.
The implied information is that "the decree" was the command of Yahweh about how the Festival of Shelters was to end. AT: "as God had commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
